article_title: How Ebola and Other Viruses Mutate
article_text:
Watch "Ebola: Are We Next?" on Thursday, Sep. 18, starting at 9/8c on both Discovery Channel and Discovery Fit & Health.

But that’s when the immune systems of host organisms -- including humans -- kick in. When the same virus tries to attach to the host cell again, it may be blocked and the virus will mutate so that it can continue replicating. Viruses can change their surface proteins to “disguise” them so that the host cells will allow them to attach.
